newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Trading simmers down after hours.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Trading simmers down after hours.

text.p: Traders said after-hours activity was settling down on Tuesday after a strong rally during market hours.
Traders said Intel Corp, which soared 5-5/8 to close at 94-1/4 and sparked a rally in the Nasdaq Composite, mostly came to a halt after the bell.
Verity Inc traded slightly up to 10-7/8, a gain of 1/4 from the company's close of 10-5/8. Verity posted first-quarter results of $0.12 loss per share compared to a loss of $0.21 per share.
The New York Stock Exchange said its first after-hours session volume was 7,900 shares compared with 3,800 shares on Monday. Session two volume was 7,255,363 shares compared with no volume on Monday.
The American Stock Exchange said there was no after-hours activity.
